intro: Gratiola nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and wetlands. Its roots are tuberous and contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Gratiola nudicaulis is often found in the eastern and central United States.
